Dating: TUTHMOSIS IV/MENKHEPERURE ?; 18TH DYNASTY; AMENHOTEP III/AMENOPHIS III/NEBMAATRE ?
Name: Stela of Turaya
Description: The lunette contains a pair of udjat-eyes flanking a shen-ring and a dish. On the left, Osiris is seated on a block throne, holding a flagellum (nekhakha-sceptre) and a crook (heqa-sceptre). On the right is a richly laden offering table and a man giving adoration. The texts were carved above and in front of the figures in eight columns.Below are three rows of text containing the offering formula. In the lower register a couple is seated on a chair, underneath which is a kneeling boy. The man is holding a lotus flower to his nose. Opposite him is an offering table and a man. A woman is kneeling in front of this man.
